ANDS-Grants.description: This project will extend and improve the effectiveness of zoo conservation education initiatives by developing post-visit web-based learning experiences. It will enable zoos to play a greater role in developing an environmentally literate society, motivate collective action for wildlife conservation and measure achievement of mission objectives.
ANDS-Grants.title: Translating zoo visitors� behavioural intentions into conservation actions using evidence-based post-visit experiences

ANDS-Grants.description: The lifetime of future fusion reactors may be severely compromised by periodic releases of internal energy which can damage the reactor walls. In an international research effort that is based on unique Australian optical technologies, the project aims to resolve some of the key issues that should allow these instabilities to be suppressed.
ANDS-Grants.title: Towards a steady-state fusion reactor: understanding and controlling eruptive instabilities in tokamaks
subjects: ATOMIC, MOLECULAR, NUCLEAR, PARTICLE AND PLASMA PHYSICS

ANDS-Grants.description: A wide range of production processes involve the use of plasmas to modify materials, but they are not well understood. This project will give Australian researchers the tools to look inside plasma processes and fully characterise them for the first time, unlocking new knowledge and providing new insight into the plasma processing environment.
ANDS-Grants.title: A diagnostics platform for advanced plasma-chemical analysis

ANDS-Grants.description: A facility capable of examining the position of individual atoms inside a material will be established to serve the Australian research community. This information will be used to design engineering alloys with improved strength, biocompatibility and reduced environmental footprints. It will also be used to characterise alloys produced by new green technologies.
ANDS-Grants.title: Investigating materials on the atomic scale using 3-dimensional atom probe tomography
